Video.Text: Here's a video about spending one-on-one time with your baby!

Set of messages 1.Message 1: The first 1000 days of life are a window of opportunity for your baby. It is when their brain develops faster than any other time in their life. When you spend time with your baby, you build a healthy attachment between you both that will make them feel secure and loved.
Set of messages 1.Message 2: It is normal to struggle to think of what to do with our babies, especially when it seems they just eat, sleep, cry, poop, and repeat. It can be especially challenging when your baby is very young and not able to talk to you.

List of tips.Message: Here are 7 easy tips to make One-on-One Time with your baby a success:

Option 1: Do it every day.Message:
1. Do it every day!
Try to spend time playing with your baby every day for at least 20 minutes where you are giving them your full attention. Choose a time when you are unlikely to be interrupted. Switch off the television and put away phones.

Option 2: Be close to your baby.Message:
2. Be close to your child. 
Skin-to-skin contact is especially important for new-borns and infants. For older toddlers, make sure you are at the same level as they are.

Option 3: Let your baby take the lead.Message 1:
3. Let your baby take the lead
Children need to do things in their own time. Try to give them time to explore and be patient. Remember that the world is brand new to your child!
Option 3: Let your baby take the lead.Message 2: Give just enough help to let it be the child’s achievement. It is okay to play alongside and copy what they are doing but try to let them keep the initiative. If your child gets frustrated, you can reassure your child by gently stroking their back.

Option 4: Observe and listen to your chi.Message 1:
4. Observe your child. 
See what facial expressions your child is making. Notice what your child is interested in or looking at.
Option 4: Observe and listen to your chi.Message 2: Listen to the sounds or words your child is making. You can even make the same sounds by copying your child!

Option 5: Play with your baby.Message 1:
5. Play with your baby
Babies learn through play! Help your child explore the world through the five senses. Let your child use all of their senses when exploring the world. Sometimes when you read to your child, your child will want to put the book in their mouth. That is okay!
Option 5: Play with your baby.Message 2: It is okay for your child to want to do many different things. Your child’s attention may wander to many different things during One-on-One Time. Anything that is happening can grab their attention: the sound of a siren, the feeling of a breeze, feelings in the body. Just keep your attention on your child.

Option 6: Talk to your baby.Message 1:
6. Talk to your baby
Start talking to your baby from the moment they are born (even before when they are in the womb). Did you know your baby can even recognise their name at a very early age? Try saying your baby's name and notice how they respond!
Option 6: Talk to your baby.Message 2: Use words to describe actions, colours, shapes, numbers, sizes, textures, temperatures, tastes, sounds, and anything else that is happening. Speak with enthusiasm when describing what your child is doing.

Option 7: You can have quality time with.Message:
7. You can have quality time with your baby anytime! 
Look for ways you can connect with your baby playfully during feeding, bathing, and dressing. You can even make bedtime a fun and nurturing experience for you and your baby in a calm way.
